meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of ruminants.
meanings.sent1: The cow chewed ruminantly on the grass in the field.
meanings.sent2: The sheep grazed ruminantly in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The goat stared ruminantly at the passing clouds.
meanings.sent4: The deer moved ruminantly through the forest, lost in its own world.
meanings.sent5: The buffalo ruminantly savored each bite of fresh greenery.

meanings.definition: In a contemplative or thoughtful manner.
meanings.sent1: She sat ruminantly on the park bench, lost in deep thought.
meanings.sent2: He gazed ruminantly at the painting, pondering its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The old man hummed ruminantly while solving the crossword puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The student walked ruminantly around campus, reflecting on the day.
meanings.sent5: The philosopher spoke ruminantly about the nature of existence.
